meanings.sent1: The economic crisis depauperated many families in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The prolonged drought depauperated the soil, making it difficult to grow crops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel depauperated its stash of acorns by hiding them all over the yard.
meanings.sent4: The constant borrowing without repayment depauperated the trust between the two friends.
meanings.sent5: The harsh winter depauperated the forest of its usual abundance of wildlife.

meanings.sent1: The factory depauperated the river by dumping toxic waste into it.
meanings.sent2: The explorers depauperated their food supplies during the long journey.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner depauperated his energy reserves before reaching the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The excessive logging depauperated the forest of its old-growth trees.
meanings.sent5: The overfishing depauperated the once-thriving fish population in the lake.

meanings.definition: To reduce in quality or value.
meanings.sent1: The cheap materials used in the construction depauperated the overall durability of the building.
meanings.sent2: The lack of maintenance depauperated the antique furniture over time.
meanings.sent3: The constant exposure to sunlight depauperated the vibrant colors of the painting.
meanings.sent4: The frequent use of the outdated software depauperated its efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The careless handling depauperated the delicate fabric of the dress.
